notesStmt.note: Ink considerably worn off (roughly retouched on folios 1-14).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A daily prayer book according to the German rite, with a commentary.

msItem.title: Special portions for Rosh ḥodesh etc.
Prayers for Rosh ha-Shanah and Yom Kipur
Prayers and readings for yamim ṭovim

collation.p: Quires of mostly 8 leaves each, marked with catchwords at the end (nearly entirely cut away).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square and semi-cursive script, partially punctuated, of the 14th century.

decoDesc.decoNote: 1r 2 decorated initial-word panels with pen flourishing, in colours.
13r 2 decorated initial-word panels with pen flourishing, in colours.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Tephilloth. German Use. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,208.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 323: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153: inscribed, folio [301v].
